intro: Didymocarpus glandulosus var. minor, commonly known as the small glandular didymocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, glandular leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
